intro: Banisteriopsis sellowiana, commonly known as the "Brazilian snakeroot," is a tropical plant native to South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family and is characterized by its woody stems and compound leaves. The plant produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale yellow. Its fruits are berries that turn red when mature, containing several seeds. It is often found in humid forests and is valued for its medicinal properties in traditional medicine.
